bug.author: DanAmador
bug.summary: Actuator folder not present when installing from Package Manager
bug.description:
Describe the bug I wanted to explore the available Examples but I can't use the library whenever I install from the package manager as the Unity.MLAgents.Actuators namespace is never downloaded. To Reproduce Just download the latest version using the unity package manager.
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7833567/93184735-e462cc80-f73c-11ea-8489-190bad8e6e2b.png></denchmark-link>
Environment:
Unity Version: Unity 2019.3.13f OS + version: Windows 10 ML-Agents version: 1.0.4 but it also happened with every package version I tried (every single one available except the preview ones)

comments.comment: The IActuator interface was added after the 1.3.0-preview release. You'll need to install from the master branch, or wait for 1.4.0-preview, which should be out this week. Copied from <denchmark-link:https://forum.unity.com/threads/actuator-missing-from-package.969159/>https://forum.unity.com/threads/actuator-missing-from-package.969159/</denchmark-link>
